Poverty Data Explorer of World Bank data: Share of population living in extreme poverty: 2011 vs. 2017 PPPs
column7: Show data from both income and expenditure surveys
column9: Extreme poverty is defined as living below the International Poverty Line, which is $1.90 per day in 2011 PPPs and $2.15 per day in 2017 PPPs. This data is adjusted for inflation and for differences in the cost of living between countries.
column11: World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform

Poverty Data Explorer of World Bank data: Poverty: Share of population living on less than the lower-middle income poverty line: 2011 vs. 2017 PPPs
column7: Show data from both income and expenditure surveys
column9: The lower-middle income poverty line is $3.20 per day in 2011 PPPs and $3.65 per day in 2017 PPPs. This data is adjusted for inflation and for differences in the cost of living between countries.
column11: World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform

Poverty Data Explorer of World Bank data: Poverty: Share of population living on less than the upper-middle income poverty line: 2011 vs. 2017 PPPs
column7: Show data from both income and expenditure surveys
column9: The upper-middle income poverty line is $5.50 per day in 2011 PPPs and $6.85 per day in 2017 PPPs. This data is adjusted for inflation and for differences in the cost of living between countries.
column11: World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform

Poverty Data Explorer of World Bank data: Poverty: Share of population living on less than the high income poverty line: 2011 vs. 2017 PPPs
column7: Show data from both income and expenditure surveys
column9: The high income poverty line is $21.70 per day in 2011 PPPs and $24.35 per day in 2017 PPPs. This data is adjusted for inflation and for differences in the cost of living between countries.
